Installs and calls sudo forever start to start node process.

added to crontab manually:
 sudo crontab -u SysStackUser -e
@reboot /home/SysStackUser/projects/proto/restartServer.sh
Calls sudo forever stop to stop node process
This component will spawn a new EC2 instance. An AWS If a security group of a specified name does not exist it will be created and attached to new instance.

Creates an AWS security group called builder-demo-group.
Provided access to builder (this) server and to user.
Adds ingress rules: 
     -ports 80,8080,22 opened for the ip returned by http://ifconfig.me & the current users client ip.

Create AWS instance and attach a security group :
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.4 (HVM)
    ImageId: 'ami-223f945a'

The keypair name to use is parsed from /home/ec2-user/.ssh/authorized_keys

Define instance with 
instanceType=t2.micro
region=us-west-2
AvailabilityZone=us-west-2a
Executes shutdown on this server after 1 minute.

Backup Builder Components
SystemsJSON.json and ./uploads will be zipped into c.backTo/backup_$fileDate.zip
Build and execute acme-client to retrieve cert, key & ca from letsencrypt. This will allow encrypted and ca verified https communication.

. 
Only challenge type 'http-01' is implemented.

c.email must be your valid email
c.commitment must be either staging (to not apply changes) or production (to apply changes)

This component will communicate with Let's Encrypt API and create  -> delete a 'challenge' file in the static folder.
Ensure this server has http port 80 open and publicly reachable via  <%a.hostName%>  and not redirecting when building. 
3 files are generated;
/home/%a.systemUser%/.ssl/%a.hostName%.key  
/home/%a.systemUser%/.ssl/%a.hostName%.cert
/home/%a.systemUser%/.ssl/%a.hostName%.csr 

After the files are generated you can enable https and redirect http to https. Restart any other servers that depend on these certs.

Standard Redhat AWS EC2
RHEL-7.3 t2.micro

The Tile Row that will hold navbars and info sections

insertHTML.value: Stack Builder
Easily design, develop and deploy custom web applications to your server for free.

ezStack Builder is a free open source Personal Configuration Manager. A working early access pre-alpha demo is available on Amazon Web Services. See the Get Started page for information on how to deploy your web application in minutes.

ops.insert:
The main row to hold the sections.
class="section main-section"

insertHTML.value: Drag and drop code

Build rich web environments for your self or for others. Spawn cloud servers and design complex self-hosted web apps using an intuitive & fun UI. Adding functionality is as easy as dropping in a new component. It`s your web server. You can be as creative as you want and there are no limits on what you can build.

alt.value: Animated illustration of components being stacked together to form a web application.

insertHTML.value: Spawn and manage your web server(s) with a few clicks. ezStack Builder gives you powerful abilities while still providing access to the details.
ezStack Builder's features are out of this world
ezStack Builder is self hosted so you have control and authority over your content.
You do not need to sign up to ezStack to use Builder.
You can take advantage of convenient and inexpensive cloud servers. Amazon AWS hosting starts at less than $2.00/month.
The web apps that you build are yours to keep or share.
Full software stack management

ezStack Builder allows you to be creative by stacking components. A component is a modular container of code, images, build/test scripts and other assets. Builder links the components together and deploys onto your server automatically.
Please take our short survey

ops.insert: Define 2 images inside a container div.

alt.value: Animated image of ezStack building this page.

insertHTML.value: ezStack Builder provides a high level user interface to complex web infrastructure and code. You and only you possess the admin credentials to your server. You are the boss. Being a full-stack developer has never been easier and the apps that you build are 100% yours.

ezStack Builder connects to servers and configures them from the bottom up for you. You can produce a completely unique online experience that is free of lock-in. Being able to set the firewall means that you can be certain that your privacy is ensured. ezStack Builder can be installed on any Linux server but the included demo components take advantage of Amazon AWS server management capabilities.

The main row to hold the sections.

insertHTML.value: Thank you for your interest in ezStack Builder
Builder is currently in pre-alpha status and you are welcome to try a working demo.

The current demo of Builder can be deployed via an Amazon AWS server image and includes a set of demo components. These components provide the ability to construct demo web applications including a "hello world" app.

The demo components are designed to run on an Amazon AWS cloud instance. If you do not already have an Amazon AWS account sign up here: aws.amazon.com. Instructions on how to launch an AWS server instance with the ezStack Builder template is listed below.
Setup Instructions

ops.insert:
Provides a simple service to get jason data from a data store.
Returns a row or all rows. 
Call service with 'id=#' to get all rows. Call with 'id=[id]' to get a specific row.
Eg: 
http://myNode/ezGet&id=#
   This will return all rows
http://myNode/ezGet&id=123
  This will return only row where id=123
